intro: Geniostoma cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces small, spadix-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near water bodies. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a starch source.
